}}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== The Emotiv '''EPOC''' is a 14-channel wireless EEG system (proprietary wireless interface) using saline electrodes. This device uses a low-power Nordic Semiconductor's chipset - it does not use Bluetooth. However, later EEG models released by Emotiv do use BT4.0, specifically, the [[Emotiv Insight]] and the [[Emotiv EPOC+]].
The '''[[Emotiv EPOC]]''' was using (see [http://www.flickr.com/photos/43372242@N06/ see also ''scubasonar''<nowiki>'</nowiki>s images here])... * A [https://www.microchip.com/wwwproducts/Devices.aspx?dDocName=en024664 '''Microchip''' dsPIC33F (dsPIC33FJ64GP206) MCU (microcontroller)] (w/ [http://www.microchip.com/stellent/idcplg?IdcService=SS_GET_PAGE&nodeId=2550 '''''CodeGuardâ„¢ Security''''']) * A [http://www.nordicsemi.com/eng/Products/2.4GHz-RF/nRF24L01 '''Nordic Semiconductor''' nRF24L01 Ultra Low Power 2.4GHz RF transceiver IC] (GFSK modulation) * Two '''Texas Instruments''' TLC2264A (marked P2264AI) OpAmps * One '''Analog Devices''' ADG706 16 -> 1 Multiplexer * A '''Texas Instruments''' ADS8326 ADC * An '''InvenSense''' IDG-300 Dual-Axis Gyro * (per FCC photos) a '''ETI TECH (M) SDN.BHD.''' G01010290218 (UT1) Li-Poly battery ... and the USB receiver dongle ([[Emotiv EPOC USB L01]]) was using a... * A [http://www.cypress.com/?docID=26942 '''Cypress Semiconductor''' CY7C64215 ('''enCoRe III''') Full-Speed (12Mbps) USB Controller] for the HID interface * .. and another [http://www.nordicsemi.com/eng/Products/2.4GHz-RF/nRF24L01 '''Nordic Semiconductor''' nRF24L01 Ultra Low Power 2.4GHz RF transceiver IC] for the other side of the wireless connection The '''EPOC''' was/is <small>probably</small> manufactured in the Philippines by [http://www.daekyung.com.ph/ '''Dae Kyung Phils. Co., Inc. (DKP)''']. [http://www.daekyung.com.ph/home/markets] [http://emotiv.com/ideas/forum/messages/forum3/topic21/message12924/]
==Links of Interest== *[https://web.archive.org/web/20121230181101/http://emotiv.com/epoc/ Product information from Emotiv, via the '''Wayback Machine'''] * {{WPLink|Emotiv}} * [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Emotiv_Systems&oldid=719510711 Old 'Emotiv Systems' Wikipedia Page] * [https://github.com/openyou/emokit '''Emokit''', an open source driver for the Emotiv EEG family] <!-- Is this the current repository? Or has something superseded it? --> ** [https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=1687432 ''Emokit: Hacking the Emotiv EPOC Brain-Computer Interface'' @ ''Hacker News'']
